intro: Schizeilema haastii var. cyanopetalum, commonly known as the blue-petaled schizeilema, is a rare and striking plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its unique, colorful inflorescence. The plant features delicate, fern-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to blue. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
